result.execSummary:
Marcel D Bell was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Marcel D Bell was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcel D Bell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Defendant has been turned over to the State of Kentucky
On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Marcel D Bell in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marcel D Bell in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Kentucky.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcel D Bell in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Marcel D Bell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Kentucky.
Defendant contested extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
